meanings.definition: The act of making something French in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The Frenchifications of the restaurant's decor added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent2: She studied the Frenchifications in the architecture of the old buildings.
meanings.sent3: The Frenchifications in the menu made the customers feel like they were dining in Paris.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was a perfect Frenchifications of chic and sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The Frenchifications of the music transported the listeners to a Parisian cafe.

meanings.definition: The process of incorporating French influences or elements into something.
meanings.sent1: The chef's Frenchifications of the traditional recipe gave it a new twist.
meanings.sent2: The film showcased the director's skillful Frenchifications of the storyline.
meanings.sent3: The Frenchifications of the painting added a touch of French flair to the exhibition.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a beautiful Frenchifications of poetry and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The Frenchifications of the garden design created a charming French atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The result of adapting or modifying something to be more French-like.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer's Frenchifications transformed the space into a cozy French retreat.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer's collection was full of elegant Frenchifications.
meanings.sent3: The Frenchifications of the play brought a touch of French humor to the audience.
meanings.sent4: His cooking had the perfect Frenchifications of flavor and presentation.
meanings.sent5: The Frenchifications of the language made it sound like a native French speaker.
